meanings.definition: The quality or state of being composed of small crystals.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the microcrystallinity of the mineral was clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the rock sample to determine the microcrystallinity present.
meanings.sent3: The jewelry maker joked that the microcrystallinity of the gemstone made it sparkle like a disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The microcrystallinity of the snow resembled a blanket of tiny diamonds covering the ground.
meanings.sent5: The unique microcrystallinity of the ice sculpture captured everyone's attention at the art exhibit.

meanings.definition: The presence of tiny crystals in a material.
meanings.sent1: The geologist analyzed the microcrystallinity of the rock to identify its composition.
meanings.sent2: The ceramic artist appreciated the beauty of the clay's microcrystallinity in the finished vase.
meanings.sent3: The baker marveled at the microcrystallinity of sugar crystals as they dissolved in the hot liquid.
meanings.sent4: The microcrystallinity of the salt on the ocean shore glistened under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The painter tried to capture the delicate microcrystallinity of frost on the window in her artwork.
